title: No accounts in brownie console (after forking local node)
body:
### Environment information

* `brownie` Version: 1.14.6
* `ganache-cli` Version: 6.12.2
* Python Version: 3.9.5
* OS: win / wsl2 (Ubuntu 20.04)

### What was wrong?

Please include information like:

1. create a new network (to have local node forkable):
`brownie networks add Development node-mainnet-fork host=http://geth.dappnode:8545 cmd=ganache-cli  mnemonic=brownie port=8545 accounts=10 evm_version=istanbul fork=mainnet gas_limit=12000000`

2. run brownie console
`brownie console --network node-mainnet-fork`

3. expect accounts to be populated with ganache's brownie accounts with some balance, actual result: no accounts
![no-acounts](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/13678461/120932407-81abc980-c6ed-11eb-8423-98165ef14096.PNG)

figured this out. For anyone who came across the same issue, the config for you local forkable node in `~/.brownie/network-config.yaml` should look like this

```
  - cmd: ganache-cli
    cmd_settings:
      accounts: 10
      evm_version: istanbul
      fork: http://geth.dappnode:8545
      gas_limit: 12000000
      mnemonic: brownie
      port: 8545
    host: http://127.0.0.1
    id: node-mainnet-fork
    name: node-mainnet-fork
```

my error was that my host was `http://geth.dappnode:8545` and my fork was `mainnet` (following the example of the existing fork).
